Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto allowed just one hit, a solo homer, before retiring the final 11 batters he faced in his first career World Series start.
Teoscar Hernández hit a go-ahead two-run homer in the third inning.
Freddie Freeman made it back-to-back homers in the third inning.
Juan Soto hit a solo home run in the third inning.
Giancarlo Stanton hit an RBI single in the ninth inning.
Blake Treinen struck out Anthony Volpe with the bases loaded in the ninth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Judge came to New York to bring the Yankees a World Series title for the first time since 2009.
Freddie Freeman was still buzzing from his walk-off grand slam to win Game 1.
Yankees manager Aaron Boone felt convicted after choosing to close Game 1 with LHP Nestor Cortes.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone thought he saw a positive sign in Aaron Judge's last at-bat of Game 1, but Judge is now 1-for-9 with six strikeouts in the World Series.
Freddie Freeman told Ken Rosenthal that his walk-off grand slam to win Game 1 still hasn't settled with him.
Miscellaneous Highlights: LA rap icon Ice Cube got the Dodger Stadium crowd warmed up with 'Bow Down' and 'It Was A Good Day'.
Fans were packing Chavez Ravine in Echo Park, and Cosm in Inglewood was also drawing quite the crowd ahead of Game 2.
